servinfo.title: DTC P2127 / P2128: Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit Low / High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P2122 / P2123: Pedal Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low / High .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: DTC P2127: Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit Low

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of pedal position sensor (sub) is less than 0.23 V.

ptxt.emph: DTC P2128: Pedal Position Sensor (Sub) Circuit High

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of pedal position sensor (sub) is more than 2.4 V.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC by using scan tool if any.
Keep the accelerator pedal at idle position for 2 seconds.
Keep the accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 seconds.
Check DTC by using scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

test1.ptxt: Check that APP sensor assembly has been mounted to vehicle body properly (no pinched floor carpet, etc.).

action.ptxt: Reinstall APP sensor assembly properly referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Removal and Installation .

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, check “APP Sensor 2 Volt” displayed on scan tool when accelerator pedal is idle position and fully depressed.

testgroup.question: Is displayed APP sensor value as described voltage in Scan Tool Data ?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from APP sensor and ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to APP sensor and ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that APP sensor (sub) circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of each APP sensor (sub) power supply, signal and ground circuit is less than 3Ω
Insulation resistance of each APP sensor (sub) power supply and signal circuit is infinity between AAP sensor connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between APP sensor (sub) power supply terminal and each other terminal at APP sensor connector.
Circuit voltage of each APP sensor (sub) power supply, signal and ground circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch turned ON

action.ptxt: Repair or replace APP sensor (sub) power supply, signal and/or ground circuit(s).

testgroup.title: APP sensor power supply voltage check

test1.ptxt: Check that circuit voltage is 5 V between APP sensor (sub) power supply terminal and vehicle body ground.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check APP sensor for performance referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known good ECM and recheck.
